get.description: GET current appstore version

post.description: Perform federated user authentication. This returns an extended user model with added apiKey property to use for allother requests. Basically it is login api for web portal(dev). There are 2 ways to login. 1. Email Login 2. VIN login. For VIN login, Client will get the jwt from routing server and attach it in the header using which we are going to login the user

oneOf.description: Requires JWT token with payload containing vin in the Authorization header.

post.description: Create a new feature toggle setting entry.

requestBody.description:
To create a product specific feature - feature_id, toggle_env

To create a user role specific feature - feature_id, toggle_env, role_id

To create an OEM specific feature - feature_id, toggle_env, role_id, oem_id

409.description: Conflict - Feature toggle setting already exists

get.description:
With no parameters, retrieve all feature toggle settings or a specific feature toggle setting based on parameters.

Parameters to get a product specific feature - feature_id, toggle_env

Parameters to get a user role specific feature - feature_id, toggle_env, role_id

Parameters to get an OEM specific feature - feature_id, toggle_env, role_id, oem_id

parameters.name: feature_id
parameters.description: ID of the feature to filter (optional)

parameters.name: toggle_env
parameters.description: Environment of the feature to filter (optional)

parameters.name: role_id
parameters.description: Role ID of the feature to filter (nullable)

parameters.name: oem_id
parameters.description: OEM ID of the feature to filter (nullable)

200.description: Successful retrieval of feature toggle settings

put.description:
Update an existing feature toggle setting by specifying the current feature_id, toggle_env, role_id, and oem_id as 'currentData', and the updated values as 'newData'.

For product-specific features, in currentData use feature_id and toggle_env.

For user role-specific features, in currentData use feature_id, toggle_env, and role_id.

For OEM-specific features, in currentData use feature_id, toggle_env, role_id, and oem_id.

requestBody.description: Feature Toggle Setting data that needs to be updated, including current and new values

delete.description:
Delete a feature toggle setting by specifying feature_id, toggle_env, role_id, and oem_id.

To delete a product specific feature - feature_id, toggle_env

To delete a user role specific feature - feature_id, toggle_env, role_id

To delete an OEM specific feature - feature_id, toggle_env, role_id, oem_id

requestBody.description:
To delete a product specific feature - feature_id, toggle_env

To delete a user role specific feature - feature_id, toggle_env, role_id

To delete an OEM specific feature - feature_id, toggle_env, role_id, oem_id

example.title: Terms and Conditions
example.content:
ATTENTION: PLEASE READ THESE TERMS CAREFULLY BEFORE USING THIS APPLICATION. BY USING THIS APPLICATION YOU ACCEPT AND AGREE TO BE BOUND AND ABIDE BY THESE TERMS OF USE). IF YOU DO NOT ACCEPT THESE TERMS, DO NOT USE THIS APPLICATION.

Use of App

These Terms of Use are entered into by and between You and Visteon Corporation (“Visteon”). The following terms and conditions, together with any documents they expressly incorporate by reference (collectively, these “Terms of Use”) govern your access to and use of www.visteon.com and any other websites owned or operated by Company (unless otherwise specified), including any content, functionality and services offered on or through www.visteon.com (the “site”). Visteon authorizes you to access, view and download the materials on the site for individual and non-commercial use, provided that you retain all copyright and other proprietary notices contained in the original materials on any copies of the materials. You may not modify, create derivative works, reproduce, publicly display, perform, republish, download, store, distribute, transmit or otherwise use for any public or commercial purpose, any of the information, materials or data presented in this site without the permission of Visteon or the copyright owner. For purposes of these Terms of Use, any use of these materials on any other internet site or networked computer environment for any purpose is prohibited. You will not take any action to jeopardize, limit or interfere in any manner with Visteon’s rights in and to the site. You agree not to portray Visteon, its products or this site in a false, misleading, derogatory or otherwise offensive manner. Visteon reserves the sole and exclusive right at its discretion to assert claims against third parties for infringement or misappropriation of its intellectual property rights in the site. The materials on this site are protected under U.S. and foreign copyright, trademark and other IP laws and Visteon reserves the rights to all material on this site with regard to such laws.

You may link to our homepage, provided you do so in a way that is fair and legal and does not damage Visteon’s reputation or take advantage of it, but you must not establish a link in such a way as to suggest any form of association, approval or endorsement on our part.

Right to Change Terms

Visteon reserves the right to, at its sole discretion, change, modify, add or remove portions of these Terms of Use at any time. All such changes to these Terms of Use will appear on this page of the site and are effective immediately upon posting. We encourage you to check for changes to these Terms of Use regularly. By using the site following any modifications to these Terms of Use, you accept and agree to be bound by any such modifications to these Terms of Use. Unless explicitly stated otherwise, any new features that augment or enhance the current site shall be subject to these Terms of Use. Visteon may restrict access to some parts of the site or the entire site.

User Submissions

To contact Visteon with questions or concerns, please email DataPriv@visteon.com.

isLatest.description: Indicates if this is the latest version

name.description: Can be used to search based on application name

limit.description: Number of records to be fetched per request

feature_id.description: Current feature ID to identify the record

toggle_env.description: Current environment (e.g., prod, local) to identify the record

is_enabled.description: Updated status of the feature toggle

trim.description: The trim of the model (if applicable).

items.description: List of restrictions applied to the app.
List of restriction types applied to the activity.

supportsNativeDriverRestriction.description: Whether the app supports native driver restrictions.

enforceVisteonPlaformRestriction.description: Whether the app enforces Visteon platform restrictions.
